name: HD 158259
scenarioDescription:
The HD 158259 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 158259 is a star with 1.08 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.21 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

HD 158259 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 158259 system


HD 158259 b

HD 158259 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 158259 b is 2.21964 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 158259 b is 1.358 that of Earth. At 2.21964 Earth masses, HD 158259 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
